value.title: Adding Pre Calculated Rank in Power BI Using Power Query
value.excerpt: There are multiple ways that you can add a RANK column to your table, You can do that dynamically inside the Power BI report using DAX Measures, or you can do it pre-calculated. If you are doing a pre-calculated rank (let‚Äôs say for an aggregated table or something like that), then it would be perhaps

value.title: Conditional Column in Power BI using Power Query   You can do anything
value.excerpt: There are many scenarios that you might want to implement a conditional expression. When the conditional expression's logic is on a row-by-row basis, the best is doing it in Power Query rather than DAX (there are exceptions always), The Add Conditional Column in Power Query is a very helpful option,

value.title: Create Customized Age Bins or Groups in Power BI
value.excerpt: Power BI has the built-in feature of creating binning for a numeric field such as age. However, the default binning will create bins of equal size. If you want to create bins of different sizes, then you need to create that as a custom column. Fortunately, Power Query has transformations that can help.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/PjHgi7X3_Bw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Generate Year and Month Combinations in Power BI Report using DAX

value.title: Relationship in Power BI with Multiple Columns

value.title: Set Power BI Data Color   All Visuals to Follow Same Color for the Same Data Point
value.excerpt: You can set the color in every visual in Power BI easily. You can also set the color of multiple visuals at the same time using Themes. value.title: Split Column by Delimiter in Power BI and Power Query
value.excerpt: If you have a delimiter character (or part of the text) that is repeated multiple times, and you want to extract all the text parts based on that, there is a simple way for it. In this article, I'll explain how to extract multiple parts of a text value based on a delimiter in Power BI using Power Query.

value.title: What a Power BI Hierarchy Is and How to Use it
value.excerpt: Power BI hierarchies are a useful structure for drill-down and data exploration in reports. A hierarchy can be created simply and can add great value for you as a developer and end-users for better data analysis. In this article and video, I‚Äôll explain what a Power BI hierarchy is and how to create it.
